page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: Cawthorne called Caltorne in Domesday Book.Very old and beautiful village All Saints church,13th Century:on site of older foundation.Saxon cross in Lady Chapel wall.Village has own museum,originally hunting lodge of Spencer Stanhope family.Their country house,Cannon Hall,with park and woods very popular local tourist attraction. 'Best Kept Village in South Yorkshire' several times.Remains of village pound and other ancient features visible today.Barugh Green and Higham are more modern:ribbon development;dormitary area on Barnsley-Manchester road.Has no industry,some local shops,no church.Nearby entrances to M.1 motorway.Several housing estates in last ten years.
